GRID ID:
Crossref Funder ID: 100013870
Other names for the organization: 
Acronym/abbreviation:
Related organizations: https://ror.org/013k5y296 (parent)
City: Pleasanton, CA
Country: USA
Geonames ID: 5383777
Year established: 2011
How will a ROR ID for this organization be used? 
Other information about this request:
comments:
adambuttrick
08/08/2022, 15:15:44 | 08/08/2022, 15:21:56
comment_text: Successor organization to https://ror.org/049922318, as identified in #955. Pharmaceutical company with offices in the US and UK. Independent, top-level entity with solid affiliation usage. Funds and employs researchers. Should be added to ROR.

#955 suggests we should add both the US and UK branch, but I think we should move away from the practice of creating separate records for national-level corporate offices that we inherited of GRID, barring actual evidence of their independence. Astex, for example, does not maintain separate sites for their two offices, but simply lists them both on their page. What might be needed in the future to accommodate this kind of international reality is for address to be a repeatable field.

Publication affiliation usage: https://europepmc.org/article/med/35512344 ; https://pubs.acs.org/doi/abs/10.1021/acs.jmedchem.2c00164 ; https://eprints.soton.ac.uk/448304/1/ParaMol_paper.pdf

Google Scholar affiliation usage: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=RvCGvpoAAAAJ; https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=WKL574IAAAAJ; https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=f_pF6fQAAAAJ

ORCID affiliation usage: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-1143-7289 ; https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2688-5965 ; https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3839-9806

title:
Split an existing ROR record into two or more records: 
 
Plant Gene Expression Centerhttps://ror.org/03rafms67
body:
Summary of request: Split an existing ROR record into two or more records

Update record:
Name of organization: 
ROR ID: 
Which part of the record needs to be changed? 
Description of change: 

Merge/split/deprecate records:
Organizations affected by this change:Plant Gene Expression Center
ROR ID(s) of organization(s) affected by this change: https://ror.org/03rafms67
How should the record(s) be changed? 2 Options - There is a need to either update the "Parent Organization" relationship of this record and add another URL to this record in order to seperate the difference in federal funding vs state funding for the "Plant Gene Expression Centers". The PGEC is a collaboration of the Agricultural Research Service of the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) and the Plant & Microbial Biology Department of the University of California, Berkeley (ECB). For the CURRENT RECORD (https://ror.org/03rafms67) the URL assigned to this record is http://pgec.berkeley.edu/ (which references the correct location of the center for the Plant Gene Expression Center - University of California, Berkley). However, the "Parent Organization" (which may need a new record to differentiate another layer of hierarchy) as part of the Pacific West Area (Plant Gene Expression Center, USDA-ARS, Albany, CA 94710, USA. Correct referencing homepage: https://www.ars.usda.gov/pacific-west-area/albany-ca/pgec/ (Plant Gene Expression Center - Albany - USDA ARS).
comments:
adambuttrick
08/12/2022, 17:44:18 | 08/12/2022, 17:44:18
comment_text: The current/UC Berkeley link in ROR references both the joint status/USDA funding and the record has the location as being in Albany, CA. In addition, both [UC Berkley](https://ror.org/01an7q238) and the [USDA Agricultural Research Service - Pacific West Area](https://ror.org/03rafms67) are already listed as parent organization for this record, so I'm not certain what we would need to change here. We could add an additional link for the USDA ARS site, as technically this is a repeating field, but it would seem that funding differentiation should happen at the level of the parents.

title:
Modify the information in an existing ROR record: 
Nantes Université https://ror.org/03gnr7b55
body:
Summary of request: Modify the information in an existing ROR record

Update record:
Name of organization: Nantes Université
ROR ID: https://ror.org/03gnr7b55
Which part of the record needs to be changed? Primary name
Description of change: On 1 January 2022, a new public higher education and research institution was created: Nantes Université. Nantes Université proposes a university model that is unique in France by uniting a university (University of Nantes), a university hospital (Nantes Université Hospital), a technological research institute (IRT Jules Verne), a national research organisation (Inserm) and three schools (Centrale Nantes, Nantes Saint-Nazaire School of Fine Arts, Nantes School of Architecture).

Update: change.name==Nantes Université; add.aliases==University of Nantes; add.aliases==Université de Nantes; delete.labels== Université de Nantes;$
comments:
adambuttrick
08/23/2022, 15:48:51 | 08/23/2022, 15:51:48
comment_text: Name change corresponds with organization's website and branding. Name on English site is also "Nantes Université." 

In terms of how this merger relates to the listed institutions, the effort is [described](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nantes_Universit%C3%A9) as an [experimental public institution](https://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regroupement_universitaire#%C3%89tablissements_publics_exp%C3%A9rimentaux), whose terms set a ten year maximum for the merger, with the option for any given institution to withdraw after two years. As such, I don't think we should deprecate these records, but simply identify Nantes Université as a new parent for https://ror.org/00qxv3c44, https://ror.org/02vjkv261, https://ror.org/03nh7d505, and https://ror.org/01jq57122. Nantes Saint-Nazaire School of Fine Art does not have a ROR ID, but I can likewise find no instance of affiliation usage under this or its French name (Beaux-Arts Nantes Saint-Nazaire), so I think it may be fine to leave it out of ROR for now. But would like to hear others' thoughts.

---

comments:
adambuttrick
08/25/2022, 15:22:59 | 08/25/2022, 15:22:59
comment_text: Long-standing university observatory in the Netherlands. Important scientific research facility, but clearly a part of the university Leiden University. Funds and employs researchers. Solid affiliation usage. Given the https://ror.org/02xse0b92, https://ror.org/01e6j9276, and https://ror.org/01mcvy510 are in ROR, I think this would have to be in scope as well.

comments:
adambuttrick
08/25/2022, 15:34:02 | 08/25/2022, 15:34:02
comment_text: Nonprofit focused on public health and social justice issues. While I can't find any instances of affiliation usage, organization's [reports](https://globalhealth5050.org/2022-report/) are frequently referenced in academic literature (e.g. https://human-resources-health.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s12960-019-0367-3 ; https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736(20)30739-X/fulltext ; https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0140673618331350). We added many similar NPOs, (e.g. https://ror.org/05xz2nh53), so I believe they're in scope for ROR.
